Name: Grace period for payment without interest of the installment of real property tax with respect to certain real property that is due and payable on January 1, 2009.
Title: A Local Law in relation to the grace period for payment without interest of the installment of real property tax with respect to certain real property that is due and payable on January 1, 2009.

History.Action: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
A motion was made that this Introduction be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
History.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity

History.Description: This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. Notwithstanding any inconsistent provision of subdivision (b) of section 11-224.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York or of any other law, for real property with an assessed value of over two hundred fifty thousand dollars, if an installment of tax due and payable on January first, two thousand nine, is not paid by January sixteenth, two thousand nine, interest shall be imposed on such unpaid amounts.
Â§2.	This local law shall take effect immediately and shall be retroactive to and deemed to have been in full force and effect as of January 1, 2009.
